title_as_recorded: Re'gime du corps|M ccc lxxxxii. Qui chomincia la fisicha del maestro Aldobrandino da Siena il quale chonpuose in linghua franciescha della santa del chorpo del uomo e di ciaschuno nenbro per se traslatata in volghare per ser Zucchero Bencivenni notaio fiorentino . . .
scribe_as_recorded: Jachopo di Domenicho vinattiere de' Seghalorzi di Firenze
former_owner_as_recorded: Inside front cover: Ex bibliotheca Com. Eq. Fabricii Orsini Rilli di Poppi. N. 263 in a Sotheby sale, ca. 1890 (according to De Ricci); Adolph Sutro (1830-1898), mayor of San Francisco.
physical_description: Binding: Bound, s. XV, in half calf over squared wooden boards, wrapped with two purple ribbons, 5 brass bosses on spine with evidence of 5 others; clasp missing.|Number of scribes, ff. 1-69v: 2 breaking between ff. 17v-18.|Script, ff. 1-69v: Mercantesca; cancelleresca.|Layout, ff. 1-69v: Gatherings of 12 leaves; 30-39 long lines frame ruled in lead.|Watermarks, ff. 1-69v: Briquet 10489 and another similar to Briquet 11659-1168.
note: Manuscript note: Burnt on fore edge, possibly from the 1906 fire in San Francisco that destroyed most of the Sutro Collection.|Bibliography: De Ricci, p. 26 as n. 2.|ff. 1-69v: Date and scribe's name on f. 1, in the opening rubric: "M ccc lxxxxii . . . lo scrisse Jachopo di Domenicho vinattiere de Seghalorzi di Firenze." Parchment reinforcing strips around the back of each quire.|Explicit, ff. 1-68v; f. 69r-v blank: Domene dio per sua grande possanza tutto il mondo istabilito.
acknowledgements: This description provided by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.
